item.title: A Message from Mme Perron:
item.description: There will be a Europe Team meeting today at lunch in room 125 All travelers must attend.

item.title: A message from Mr. Warner:
item.description: There will be an open gym session for grade 7 - 8 girls basketball tomorrow after school from 2:20 to 3:40. Any questions contact Mr. Warner

item.title: A message from Mme. Perron
item.description: The Europe Team is selling Hand crafted Charcuterie Boards for the Easter Holiday. Boards will be on sale tonight at the Open House and available for purchase online. Any staff interested are asked to please see Mme Perron, Mme Bourdon, Mr Kwok or Ms Montgommery and we will be happy to direct you to the website for purchase. All boards will feed 6 to 8 people and will be delivered to the school for pick up on Holy Thursday just in time for Easter Celebrations on April 2nd. Students will also be selling Chocolate Almonds next week and check out our table tonight at open house for 50/50 tickets paired with the Russell Legion.

item.title: A message from: Ms. Brennan.
item.description: This is a reminder of the Garden Club meeting at the start of lunch in room 201 today. See you there!

item.title: A message from: Mme Laneville:
item.description: Our Grade 7â€“8 Girls Volleyball Team, competed in their first big tournament yesterday in Casselman. The team played with determination and heart, finishing third in their round robin and battling hard all the way through playoffs. After an intense bronze medal match, they ended the day with a respectable fourth place finish out of 10 teams! Your coach is very proud of the incredible sportsmanship, teamwork, and positive energy you showed throughout the day. You represented STA with pride, spirit, and class.
